body.name: SABRE Universal Portable Door Lock with Travel Bag, Durable Travel Friendly Door Lock for Hinged Doors, Lightweight, Additional Security for Homes, Rentals, Apartments, Hotels & Commercial Buildings

features: ​​PERSONAL PROTECTION YOU CAN TRUST: SABRE is the #1 pepper spray brand trusted by police & consumers & a leader in the personal safety category

MAXIMUM SECURITY: Keep yourself and your belongings safe wherever you go - this TSA-approved portable door lock is compatible with most hinged doors that swing inward and is great for hotels, apartments, commercial buildings, and homes
SAFETY ON THE GO: Lightweight and compact size is perfect for added security while traveling, such as in hotels, shared vacation rentals, and extended stay homes; Includes travel bag for easy packing
RELIABLE PROTECTION: Metal body construction and rugged design provides durable and sturdy protection so you can have peace of mind and enjoy your travels
Easy Installation: No tools or wiring needed for quick installation that can be done in seconds; Requires at least 1/8 of an inch gap between the door and frame​
body.description: Add more comfort and relaxation to your vacation with the SABRE Universal Portable Door Lock. This door lock is perfect for adding peace of mind and keeping you and your loved ones safe on your travels, whether it be in a hotel room or shared vacation rental. It works on most hinged doors that swing inward for your convenience. Requires at least 1/8 of an inch gap between the door and frame​ for use. Featuring a metal body construction, this durable and rugged door lock can help provide reliable protection to your room. The door lock also includes a travel bag for easy carrying and packing. It's easy to install and sets up with minutes - no additional tools or wiring required. The door lock's compact size makes it perfect for traveling and is also a TSA approved lock. This multi-purpose door alarm isn't just a travel essential - it's great to use on your own apartment, home, dorm room, and commercial buildings. The Universal Portable Door Lock was developed by SABRE, the #1 pepper spray brand trusted by police and consumers worldwide. Backed by over 45 years in the security industry, SABRE products are ISO 9001:2015 certified and must pass rigorous quality assurance testing before leaving our facilities to give you peace of mind. Improve your home security today.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good travel option for safety and peace of mind
reviews.reviewText: This portable door lock is quite sturdy. It is advertised as being able to resist 500lbs of force, and while I did not apply that much in testing, I certainly could tell that no one was getting through without some sort of machinery. It is easy to lock in place and take down, and only requires about 20 seconds to place. It is very portable and ideal for travel. For the price, this product provides unparalleled security, and I would highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cool tool for traveling, just read and try it BEFORE you go
reviews.reviewText: This door lock is a pretty straightforward, simple solution to protect against kick-ins. The instructions are clear and just about anyone can engage the lock. It says it can withstand 500 pounds of forced, so that’s pretty heavy duty. However, because of that, I have some concerns.I don’t like the idea that I have to rely on the release mechanism always working and if that release button doesn’t work, then I’m left barricaded in the room. Can the fire dept apply more than 500lbs of force? I don’t know. Because of that I would probably not use this unless I had a second fire escape route.While I don’t know that it wouldn’t work, I would still be cautious. I noticed that there are four small screws on one side of the mechanism, so potentially I could remove those screws to disengage the lock from the inside of the door. (I tried it.) That would be my back up plan if the button didn’t work, but it means that I have to bring a screwdriver with me if I’m traveling.Otherwise, I would be happy to have this, particularly if I was traveling alone.One thing that’s important to note is that you MUST have at least an eighth of an inch gap between the door and the door frame to use this lock. It says on the packaging that if there isn’t at least that much gap do not close the door. It doesn’t say why you can’t close the door, but it sounds like it may be a problem getting it open again if you do.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great little addition for some peace of mind.
reviews.reviewText: I haven't traveled anywhere to use this in a 'hotel' setting, but have tested this at home and it is quick and easy to setup. Overall it is a great addition to any travel bad for some added peace of mind, and some privacy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Chunky door lock...
reviews.reviewText: It's seemingly built well and does help prevent accidental intrusion but I want to make it clear that this device likely will only deter or temporarily block someone from gaining access through the door it's placed on. Most household doors are wood and with enough kicking this thing will fall off the door as the handle and/or the frame of the door break. If you're using this on a metal door it would likely fare better but remember that it wont stop someone from coming through a window or other access point. I think it's important to share those thoughts up front as to not oversell the product as some miracle security device providing a false sense of security. If you generally just need added piece of mind that in normal situations someone can't accidentally enter your room then this is probably a good fit for you. Otherwise it's a bit chunky and not as compact as some of the others in the market but it does seem a bit better built as the trade off. Grab one as a gift for your traveling friend or family member or yourself and if you can get it on sale I think it'd be a good value. Stay safe out there!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars An extra layer of security, good in certain use cases.
reviews.reviewText: I’ve tried a few portable door locks for travel, but none have really been ideal.The popular ones with the triangular-ish thingee chained to a metal plate are a little bulky and tend to clang around in your bag.The rectangular block with a slide out bar thingee is more portable, but doesn’t work on all doors/doorframes, and at least on the one I tried, the bar was a little narrow.This is silent to carry since there aren’t any loose parts, and has the same limitations on not working on some doors/doorframes as most (all?) similar devices, but has two main concerns:1 - The pointy-ish metal bar sticks out about 5.25“ (pic), which is potentially dangerous for kids (or inebriated adults) running around.2 - While not sharp, it’s still primarily a fairly hefty metal stake, which I’m not 100% sure TSA would allow you to carry on a plane. The description says it’s TSA-approved, but good luck arguing that to a grumpy agent.So, if you nor anyone you’re staying with are likely to run into a doorknob, and you’re not flying, it’s a pretty decent deterrent.Packaging is tamper-evident, being a plastic clamshell surrounded by cardboard, so it’s obvious if it’s been used or not.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: great door lock-it works on my door but i do feel like its tough to know if this will work on your door or not until you actually get it. i feel it helps keep the door locked and i need that in my home to keep my dogs seperated since they dont get along. i always have fear that they might push the door in and get to each other but with this tool it gives me peace of mind. i highly recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars NOT a universal fit, could not use
reviews.reviewText: This is the first time I've considered using an extra security/door measure as I moved into an up and coming neighborhood. I do have a lock and padlock, but I was hoping for something a bit more with this, the SABRE Universal Portable Door Lock with Travel Bag, Durable Travel Friendly Door Lock for Hinged Doors, Lightweight, Additional Security for Homes, Rentals, Apartments, Hotels & Commercial Buildings.Unfortunately for me, this is NOT actually truly a universal fit for doors. I tried for about 15 minutes to figure out how it would fit, then got a few more people involved, and the conclusion was that I did not have the proper space allotment to get this installed on my door. Apparently, per the manufacturer, you must have a 1/8 inch space gap for this to fit. I guess I have less than 1/8 inch space.The construction seems solid. It comes in a nice velvet-y pouch for storage/travel. Presumably the pouch will make sure the edges of the security device do not damage clothing and other items in your suitcase.The description also says it's TSA approved. I have no idea what would even NEED to be approved on this for TSA, but ok?Bottom line: didn't work for me at my home, where I REALLY need it, but I will hold on to this and take on solo trips for added security. HOPEFULLY it actually works in other doors than mine.
